    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public static int getColor(java.lang.String hexDecimalColor)
        Gets the integer value for the given String hex-decimal color.
        Returns -1 if the provided String is empty.
        Parameters:
        hexDecimalColor - -String hex decimal color.
        Returns:
        int -parsed integer color code.
        See Also:
        Color#parseColor(String)}.

      • getHexDecimalColor

        public static java.lang.String getHexDecimalColor(int colorCode)
        Returns the hex-decimal color value for the provided int-color code.
        Parameters:
        colorCode - -int for the color code.
        Returns:
        String -hex-deximal color.

      • isOpaque

        public static boolean isOpaque(int colorCode)
        Check whether the provide Color is opaque or not.
        Parameters:
        colorCode - -int for the color code.
        Returns:
        boolean - returns true if color is opaque, else false.

      • getDesaturatedColor

        public static int getDesaturatedColor(int originalColor)
        Returns less saturated color for the provided color code.
        The color is 10% lighter than provided color code.
        Parameters:
        originalColor - - int color code.
        Returns:
        int -desaturated /less saturated color.

      • getSaturatedColor

        public static int getSaturatedColor(int originalColor)
        Returns more saturated color for the provided color code.
        The color is 10% saturated than provided color code.
        Parameters:
        originalColor - - int color code.
        Returns:
        int -saturated /more saturated color.

      • getRandomColor

        public static int getRandomColor()
        Returns random color code.
